snippet: The writings of Philip Chlanda provide a rare, firsthand account of an officer’s encounter with an emotionally disturbed person but were not an indication of his future.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on the online journal of New York City Police Officer Philip Chlanda, which provided a firsthand account of the officer's decision not to use his gun in a confrontation with an emotionally disturbed person holding a weapon; notes that clear and calm description of the encounter gives no clue that within four years Chlanda would turn that same gun on himself in a suicide over a broken romance.
lead_paragraph: The writings of Philip Chlanda provide a rare, firsthand account of an officer’s encounter with an emotionally disturbed person but were not an indication of his future.

headline.seo: A Police Officer’s Journal Cited His Use of Restraint
headline.main: A Rookie’s Online Journal Citing Gun Restraint Gave No Clue
